base change.text: $We say that \mathcal{P}$ is stable under base change, if for every morphism $f \colon X 	o S$ with property $\mathcal{P}$, and every morphism $g \colon S' 	o S$, the base change $f' \colon X 	imes_{S} S' 	o S$ has $\mathcal{P}$. The cells may put conditions on $g$.

local on the source.text: Let $	au \in \{ \mathrm{Zariski}, \mathrm{fpqc}, \mathrm{fppf}, \mathrm{'etale}, \mathrm{smooth}, \mathrm{syntomic}\}$. We say $\mathcal{P} is $	au$ local on the source, if for every morphism of schemes $f \colon X 	o Y$ over $S$, and every $	au$-covering $\{X_i 	o X\}_{i \in I} we have $$f 	ext{ has } \mathcal{P} \iff 	ext{ each } X_i 	o Y 	ext{ has } \mathcal{P}.$$ The cells specify the finest (TODO) $	au$

local on the target.text: Let $	au \in \{ \mathrm{Zariski}, \mathrm{fpqc}, \mathrm{fppf}, \mathrm{'etale}, \mathrm{smooth}, \mathrm{syntomic}\}$. We say $\mathcal{P} is $	au$ local on the target, if for every morphism of schemes $f \colon X 	o Y$ over $S$, and every $	au$-covering $\{Y_i 	o Y\}_{i \in I} we have $$f 	ext{ has } \mathcal{P} \iff 	ext{ each } Y_i 	imes_Y X 	o Y_i 	ext{ has } \mathcal{P}.$$ The cells specify the finest (TODO) $	au$

cancellation.text: We say $\mathcal{P}$ satisfies cancellation if for all morphisms of schemes $f \colon X 	o Y$ and $g \colon Y 	o Z$ such that $g \circ f$ has $\mathcal{P}$, then $f$ has $\mathcal{P}$. The cells may put conditions on $g$.
